author: Kyle Mercado
project_summary: Create a similar videogame across 3 javascript frameworks to test the viability of creating videogames on webpages for extended usability and accessibility
questions: Considering the results of this project, would you recommend a particular framework for developing web-based games, or does it depend on the specific requirements of each project?
recommendations: Consider adding an endpoint to the game that will let users know game is complete. Project is very good with more development it can easily be an 8

author: Peter Chuku
project_summary: Impact of different web development frameworks and languages on user engagement and learning outcomes on educational websites through the development of three versions of an educational web application. Triple mod: html/css/js, react, vue
comments: I was able to acess implementation 1, nice project very interactive. Was not able to access 2 and 3
questions: How did the choice of web development frameworks (HTML/CSS/JavaScript, React.js, Vue.js) impact the development process and overall user experience of the educational web application?
recommendations: Project is very good, if you are able to find a way to make your implementations live this project can be a 6?

author: Brianna Lopez
project_summary: Impact of cryptocurrencies on traditional financial systems and their potential to revolutionize various industries. Triple Mod: slidy, Marp, Python
comments: All three links work excellent project!
questions: In your opinion, what are the most promising use cases for cryptocurrencies beyond finance, and how do you envision them revolutionizing various industries in the future?
recommendations: I think CMMI and TRL is appropiate for this project!

author: Jay Estiva
project_summary: Explore accessibility guidelines set by WCAG 2.0 and 2.1 and see how well these guidelines are used by today's popular websites and social media. Triple Mod: html/css/js, react, php
comments: I was not able to access link for imlementation 3. Overall great work!
questions: How do you envision the future of web accessibility, considering the evolving landscape of web development technologies and frameworks?
recommendations: I think CMMI and TRL is appropiate for this project! If you can find a solution to make 3rd implementation live it can bump up to an 8

author: Ian Cheung
project_summary: Focusing on the Internet of Things and what operating systems and browsers are used. The goal is to display some images and graphics. Trip Mod: google pie chart, bar chart html/CSS, Pie chart excell
comments: all three links work excellent project! I like how interacive some of the graphs are!
questions: How did you approach ensuring accessibility and readability in the visualizations, particularly across different devices and screen sizes?
recommendations: I think CMMI and TRL is appropiate for this project!
